=Downloads=
ZDoom now comes in multiple flavours! The primary port, GZDoom, sports advanced hardware (OpenGL) and enhanced software rendering capabilities, while its sister port QZDoom serves a test bed for new (stable) features. Although the parent ZDoom codebase has been discontinued, the latest official release is available here for posterity.

For help getting started, see [[Installation and execution of ZDoom|the online documentation in the wiki]]. '''You need to provide your own game [[IWAD]]'''. If you do not have a copy of a doom-engine game, the easiest way to obtain them is to purchase them from [[doomwiki:Steam|Steam]] or [[doomwiki:GOG.com|GOG]]. When you download them from either of these stores, ZDoom will automatically find them.
==Support==

[[ZDL]]

Want a simple launcher to make using ZDoom easier? Try this.

{{sitelink|files/timidity4zdoom2.zip|TiMidity++}}

ZDoom supports using {{plainlink|[http://timidity.sourceforge.net/ TiMidity++]}} for MIDI playback. To use it, extract timidity.exe and timidity.cfg and [[TiMidity++|read the instructions]].

{{sitelink|files/libfluidsynth.7z|FluidSynth DLL (version 1.1.6)}}
{{sitelink|files/libfluidsynth64.7z|(64-bit version)}}

ZDoom supports using {{plainlink|[http://www.fluidsynth.org FluidSynth]}} for MIDI playback. To use it, extract libfluidsynth.dll to the same directory as zdoom.exe and then [[FluidSynth|configure it]] from within ZDoom.
==Editing== Everything you need to start creating ZDoom mods.

[[File:SladeIcon.png|link=http://slade.mancubus.net/]]{{plainlink|[http://slade.mancubus.net/ SLADE 3]}}

A full-fledged level and resource editor for Doom; which supports most *ZDoom features. Available for Windows, Mac, and Linux.

[[File:DB2Icon.png|link=https://github.com/jewalky/GZDoom-Builder-Bugfix]]{{plainlink|[https://github.com/jewalky/GZDoom-Builder-Bugfix GZDoom Builder-Bugfix]}}

A level editor with complete support of *ZDoom features. Windows-only.

{{sitelink|files/utils/acc/acc155win.zip|ACC 1.55 Windows Version}}

ACS script compiler for use with ZDoom and/or Hexen. This is not the version of ACC released by {{plainlink|[http://www.ravensoft.com Raven]}}. It supports all off ZDoom's language extensions.

{{sitelink|files/utils/zdbsp/zdbsp-1.19.zip|ZDBSP 1.19}}

This is a standalone version of ZDoom's internal node builder. Its most important feature is that it knows about polyobjects, but it can also build GL nodes if you don't want to wait for glBSP to do it. At the time of writing, it is also the only nodebuilder with [[UDMF]] support.
==Utilities== These tools support a few special editing and playing scenarios.

{{plainlink|[https://bitbucket.org/JPLeBreton/wadsmoosh WadSmoosh]}}

Merges your Doom IWADs (Doom, Doom 2, Final Doom, Master Levels, etc.) into a single IWAD, allowing players to switch between games without relaunching.

{{plainlink|[https://github.com/coelckers/wadext/releases WadExt]}}

A command-line utility that extracts the contents of a WAD to a (mostly) pk3-compatible folder structure. Useful for converting old mods or setting up advanced development workflows.

{{sitelink|files/utils/mapinfoconv.zip|MAPINFO Converter}}

This is a command-line utility written by Graf Zahl to convert [[MAPINFO_(old_format)|old-format MAPINFO]] lumps to [[MAPINFO|new-format ones]]. See the {{forum|f=3&t=20833|original forum thread}} for more information. This package contains both a Windows binary and source code.

{{sitelink|files/utils/utils050999.zip|Misc Editing Utilities}}

Includes the programs '''zwadconv''', '''swantbls''', and '''listacs'''. '''Zwadconv''' converts old maps to the Hexen format used by ZDoom natively. '''Swantbls''' creates SWITCHES and ANIMATED lumps used by BOOM. '''Listacs''' is an ACS script disassembler (not decompiler).

{{sitelink|files/utils/utilsrc050999.zip|Utility Source Code}}

Contains the source code for the editing utilities.
==Miscellaneous== The following files are mostly of historic interest.

{{sitelink|files/utils/acc/acc155-src.zip|ACC 1.55 Source Code}}

This is the latest source code for ZDoom's version of ACC. It includes both a makefile for GCC and a project file for Visual C++ 6, so you can build a Windows, DOS, or Linux version. It is also available on its {{plainlink|[https://github.com/rheit/acc/ GitHub repository]}}.

{{sitelink|files/utils/zdbsp/zdbsp-1.19-src.zip|ZDBSP 1.19 Source Code}}

This is the source code for ZDBSP 1.19. The build system uses CMake, so you can generate project files for any version of Visual C++ from 6 up or several other IDEs, or you can create Makefiles as well. It is also available on its {{plainlink|[https://github.com/rheit/zdbsp/ GitHub repository]}}.

{{sitelink|files/utils/acc/acc155.zip|ACC 1.55 WadAuthor/DOS Version}}

This version of ACC is only if you're old-school and using WadAuthor or a DOS-based editor like ZETH.

{{sitelink|files/zdoom-wauthor.zip|WadAuthor Configuration Files}}

Contains a wcf file for use with {{plainlink|[http://users.ameritech.net/wadauthor/wauthor.htm WadAuthor]}}.

{{sitelink|files/zeth/zeth417.zip|ZETH 4.17 Level Editor}}

A DETH-based editor for ZDoom that runs in a DOS box. Comes with minimal documentation. If you don't already know how to use DETH, you should go find a good {{plainlink|[http://www.doomworld.com/drsleep/editing.htm#tutors tutorial]}} that explains it. If you plan on doing any ACS scripting, you should be sure to also download ACC below.

{{sitelink|files/zeth/zeth417-src.zip|ZETH 4.17 Source Code}}

This is the source code for ZETH. Hopefully somebody will find it useful.

{{sitelink|files/examples/demo.zip|Old (1999) Demonstration WAD}}

Shows off some of the features that were new as of ZDoom 1.22.

{{sitelink|files/ref121299.zip|Old (1999) Editing Reference}}

Downloadable copy of the Editing Reference for offline viewing. This has only been updated for ZDoom 1.22. For ZDoom features added since then, you should consult the [[Main Page|wiki documentation]] instead.
